intro: Hieracium rigidum subsp. scabrescens, commonly known as the rough hawkweed, is a perennial herbaceous plant native to parts of Europe and Asia. It typically grows in dry, open habitats such as grasslands and disturbed soils. The plant features upright stems that are covered in stiff, bristly hairs, giving it a rough texture. Its basal leaves are lance-shaped and also hairy, while the flowers are yellow and arranged in a single head. It is characterized by its distinctive, rough appearance and is often found in sunny, well-drained environments.
